title: When Poets Decide Who Counts
description: All month long, we've been answering versions of one giant question: Who counts in 2020? Well, April is poetry month, so we decided to end our series by asking some of our favorite poets who they think counts — and how all of that has changed in these strange, new times.
copyright: Copyright 2015-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: When Poets Decide Who Counts
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: To close out National Poetry Month, we asked poets of color the question we've been asking in each episode this month: What does it mean to be counted in 2020?
itunes:subtitle: To close out National Poetry Month, we asked poets of color the question we've been asking in each episode this month: What does it mean to be counted in 2020?
content:encoded: All month long, we've been answering versions of one giant question: Who counts in 2020? Well, April is poetry month, so we decided to end our series by asking some of our favorite poets who they think counts — and how all of that has changed in these strange, new times.
